title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in Java editor
description: The revert operation in the Java editor is significantly slower than the close and reopen operations.
OB:
When opening the editor for the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository, and making a change to the file, the following behaviors were observed:

1) When closing the editor by clicking on the close box in the editor tab and answering 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, it takes about 8 seconds for the editor to close. 
2) When double-clicking on the file in the navigator to reopen it after closing, it takes about 8 seconds for the file to open again.
3) When selecting 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor after making changes, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original contents.
EB: The expected behavior is that both the close and reopen operations and the revert operation should take a similar amount of time to perform.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:

1) Open the Java editor for the file org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open source repository.
2) Make a change to the file by adding a space character at the end of the first line.
3) Wait for the editor to indicate that the file is dirty.
4) Close the editor by clicking on the close box in the editor tab and select 'no' when prompted to save changes.
5) Observe the time it takes for the editor to close.
6) Double-click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
7) Observe the time it takes for the file to open again.
8) Repeat steps 1-3 to make the file dirty again.
9) Select 'Revert' from the editor's pop-up menu.
10) Observe the time it takes for the contents of the window to be replaced with the original contents.
